hanging-punctuation-property.name: hanging-punctuation
hanging-punctuation-property.summary: The hanging-punctuation CSS property specifies whether a punctuation mark should hang at the start or end of a line of text. Hanging punctuation may be placed outside the line box.

safari.notes: The force-end keyword is recognized but has no effect.

safari_ios.notes: The force-end keyword is recognized but has no effect.

hanging-punctuation-property.title: hanging-punctuation

hyphens-property.name: hyphens
hyphens-property.summary: The hyphens CSS property specifies how words should be hyphenated when text wraps across multiple lines.

chrome.notes: auto value is only supported on macOS and Android and for languages the OS provides hyphenation for.

firefox.notes: Automatic hyphenation only works for languages with hyphenation dictionaries that are integrated into Firefox.

firefox_android.notes: Automatic hyphenation only works for languages with hyphenation dictionaries that are integrated into Firefox.

ie.notes: Only works if the specified language is the same as the language of the underlying OS.

opera.notes: auto value is only supported on macOS and Android.

edge_blink.notes: auto value is only supported on macOS and Android and for languages the OS provides hyphenation for.

hyphens-property.title: hyphens

letter-spacing-property.name: letter-spacing
letter-spacing-property.summary: The letter-spacing CSS property sets the horizontal spacing behavior between text characters. This value is added to the natural spacing between characters while rendering the text. Positive values of letter-spacing causes characters to spread farther apart, while negative values of letter-spacing bring characters closer together.
letter-spacing-property.title: letter-spacing

letter-spacing-property.name: letter-spacing
letter-spacing-property.summary: The letter-spacing attribute controls spacing between text characters, in addition to any spacing from the kerning attribute.
letter-spacing-property.title: letter-spacing

line-break-property.name: line-break
line-break-property.summary: The line-break CSS property sets how to break lines of Chinese, Japanese, or Korean (CJK) text when working with punctuation and symbols.
line-break-property.title: line-break

propdef-overflow-wrap.name: overflow-wrap
propdef-overflow-wrap.summary: The overflow-wrap CSS property applies to inline elements, setting whether the browser should insert line breaks within an otherwise unbreakable string to prevent text from overflowing its line box.
propdef-overflow-wrap.title: overflow-wrap

propdef-overflow-wrap.name: word-wrap
propdef-overflow-wrap.summary: The overflow-wrap CSS property applies to inline elements, setting whether the browser should insert line breaks within an otherwise unbreakable string to prevent text from overflowing its line box.
propdef-overflow-wrap.title: overflow-wrap

tab-size-property.name: tab-size
tab-size-property.summary: The tab-size CSS property is used to customize the width of tab characters (U+0009).

chrome.notes: This property is not yet animatable.

chrome_android.notes: This property is not yet animatable.

notes: See bug 737785 for the status of unprefixing this property.
Before Firefox 53, this property was not animatable.
See bug 737785 for the status of unprefixing this property.
Before Firefox 53, this property was not animatable.

samsunginternet_android.notes: This property is not yet animatable.

edge_blink.notes: This property is not yet animatable.

tab-size-property.title: tab-size

text-align-last-property.name: text-align-last
text-align-last-property.summary: The text-align-last CSS property sets how the last line of a block or a line, right before a forced line break, is aligned.

notes: IE only supports text-align-last when text-align is set to justify.
The start and end values are not supported.

text-align-last-property.title: text-align-last

text-align-property.name: text-align
text-align-property.summary: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of a block element or table-cell box. This means it works like vertical-align but in the horizontal direction.
text-align-property.title: text-align

text-indent-property.name: text-indent
text-indent-property.summary: The text-indent CSS property sets the length of empty space (indentation) that is put before lines of text in a block.
text-indent-property.title: text-indent

text-justify-property.name: text-justify
text-justify-property.summary: The text-justify CSS property sets what type of justification should be applied to text when text-align: justify; is set on an element.

chrome.notes: inter-word and distribute (deprecated) values are supported, but distribute behavior is buggy.

chrome_android.notes: inter-word and distribute (deprecated) values are supported, but distribute behavior is buggy.

ie.notes: Standard values inter-character and none are supported. The deprecated distribute value is also supported.

opera.notes: inter-word and distribute (deprecated) values are supported, but distribute behavior is buggy.

opera_android.notes: inter-word and distribute (deprecated) values are supported, but distribute behavior is buggy.

edge_blink.notes: inter-word and distribute (deprecated) values are supported, but distribute behavior is buggy.

text-justify-property.title: text-justify

text-transform.name: text-transform
text-transform.summary: The text-transform CSS property specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized. It also can help improve legibility for ruby.

chrome.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (nor for the one-colon syntax). See Chromium bug 129669.

chrome_android.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (nor for the one-colon syntax). See Chromium bug 129669.

opera.notes: Since Opera 15, the text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (nor for the one-colon syntax). See Chromium bug 129669.

safari.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (also not for the old one-colon syntax). See WebKit bug 3409.

safari_ios.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (also not for the old one-colon syntax). See WebKit bug 3409.

samsunginternet_android.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (nor for the one-colon syntax). See Chromium bug 129669.

webview_android.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (nor for the one-colon syntax). See Chromium bug 129669.

edge_blink.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (nor for the one-colon syntax). See Chromium bug 129669.

text-transform.title: text-transform

propdef-white-space.name: white-space
propdef-white-space.summary: The white-space CSS property sets how white space inside an element is handled.
propdef-white-space.title: white-space

word-break-property.name: word-break
word-break-property.summary: The word-break CSS property sets whether line breaks appear wherever the text would otherwise overflow its content box.

ie.notes: No version of Internet Explorer supports the initial value.
Don't use -ms-word-break, which is a synonym for word-break.

word-break-property.title: word-break

propdef-word-spacing.name: word-spacing
propdef-word-spacing.summary: The word-spacing CSS property sets the length of space between words and between tags.
propdef-word-spacing.title: word-spacing

word-spacing-property.name: word-spacing
word-spacing-property.summary: The word-spacing attribute specifies spacing behavior between words.
word-spacing-property.title: word-spacing
